definition: surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: I translated three of Chao's books.
sentences.chinese: 我翻译了赵树理的三本书。

sentences.english: Zhao Shuli s novels embodies elegance from its popularization.
sentences.chinese: 赵树理小说在通俗化中呈现出了高雅的氛围。

sentences.english: Frankly, I was disappointed in Chao's books.
sentences.chinese: 说实话，我对赵树理的书感到失望。

sentences.english: All of the evaluation on Zhao Shuli's works should base on this point.
sentences.chinese: 这是评价赵树理文学作品的一个基点。

sentences.english: Chao always had more white beans than black.
sentences.chinese: 赵树理的白豆总是比黑豆多。

definition: The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River, proletarian novel by Ding Ling, winner of 1951 Stalin prize
pinyin: Tai4 yang2 Zhao4 Zai4 Sang1 gan1 He2 Shang4

definition: Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Yao Xueyin (1910-1999), PRC novelist, author of historical novel Li Zicheng 李自成
Yangge opera, a rural form of theater
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
